title: 2D Axisymmetric Simulation Model of Electrostatic Force Microscopy for Detecting Buried Carbon Nanotubes in Poly(methyl methacrylate) Matrix
content: The identification of nanomaterials in biological samples is crucial due to their extensive applications in agriculture, biomedicine, and food packaging, prompting concerns about potential health risks. Investigating subsurface imaging techniques, particularly Electrostatic Force Microscopy (EFM), is essential for comprehending intracellular nanomaterial behavior. EFM has emerged as a valuable electrical characterization technique for subsurface analysis, especially in detecting and characterizing nanoparticles within a matrix.
